channel.title: Dream Discussion
channel.description:
OH GOD NOT ANOTHER ONE.
But yea. I feel like talking about dreams again, but not the kinds, simply what happens to you in them. I, for example, can often feel pain in my dreams, and I can still feel it after waking up (I got cut in a dream once and got a bandage due to me still feeling it). Also, I can taste, smell, and even distinguish hot and cold things in my dreams. But the one thing that absolutely puzzles me in my dreams is why I can't scream. In every dream that I tried screaming in, I never could. I just don't understand why I can do just about anything else in my dreams except scream. Oh well, it's just one more mental problem with me :3. Now discuss, because I know topics like these tend to interest many people :s

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:20, topic:328559”]I love how often De JaVu occurs in dreams. Just something random in a dream, then a day, week, even month later you experience that event. The question is, when will scientist harness the power into the future?[/quote]I think everyone has those at some point. Pretty sure they’re called premonitions.

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:22, topic:328559”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=424946.msg3122072#msg3122072 date=1265609987]
I love how often De JaVu occurs in dreams. Just something random in a dream, then a day, week, even month later you experience that event. The question is, when will scientist harness the power into the future?
[/quote]

I’m pretty sure this has happened to me before. There’s been A LOT of times when I was growing up where something has happened or things have been said in a sequence by people like my family or friends where it seemed so damn familiar, like the exact same thing that was happening then has happened before.[/quote]

And sooner or later, scientist will go into our head upon dreams and exact the information to find out the whole course of our life!

Read full topic

I’m pretty sure this has happened to me before. item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:20, topic:328559”]I love how often De JaVu occurs in dreams. Just something random in a dream, then a day, week, even month later you experience that event. The question is, when will scientist harness the power into the future?

runefreak10:

It seems to me that the dreams you have always are perfect timing. Like it’s hard to explain. For example, in your dream someone is about to wake you up, and in real life at that exact same time someone wakes you up. Or like this happened to me once. I had a dream I was being chased by someone and they were trying to kill me. The very second the person caught me and was about to stab me, my friend smacked me in the face and woke me up. It’s so weird how your dreams time up so perfectly with interactions in real life before they even happen. It’s almost like your mind is reading the future seconds before it happens.

Perfect example…How do we know to see into the future? Dreams are often overlooked but they could be a key for the look of how our life will turn out…[/quote]
so your saying some guy will be chasing runefreak and trying to kill him sometime in the future?

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I love how often De JaVu occurs in dreams. Just something random in a dream, then a day, week, even month later you experience that event. The question is, when will scientist harness the power into the future?

It seems to me that the dreams you have always are perfect timing. Like it's hard to explain. For example, in your dream someone is about to wake you up, and in real life at that exact same time someone wakes you up. Or like this happened to me once. I had a dream I was being chased by someone and they were trying to kill me. The very second the person caught me and was about to stab me, my friend smacked me in the face and woke me up. It's so weird how your dreams time up so perfectly with interactions in real life before they even happen. It's almost like your mind is reading the future seconds before it happens.

Perfect example…How do we know to see into the future? Dreams are often overlooked but they could be a key for the look of how our life will turn out…

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

This topic is actually a topic that I find very interesting and worth making a good post on.

It seems to me that the dreams you have always are perfect timing. Like it’s hard to explain. For example, in your dream someone is about to wake you up, and in real life at that exact same time someone wakes you up. Or like this happened to me once. I had a dream I was being chased by someone and they were trying to kill me. The very second the person caught me and was about to stab me, my friend smacked me in the face and woke me up. It’s so weird how your dreams time up so perfectly with interactions in real life before they even happen. It’s almost like your mind is reading the future seconds before it happens. I also find it funny how the dream you’re having could be scaring the shit out of you and you wake up. Then minutes later you fall back asleep right back into that dream but you could be having a dream where you’re fucking the hottest girl in the world and when you wake up and can’t go back to sleep. Then you sit there for like 20 minutes keeping your eyes shut tight knowing you’re not going to fall back asleep because you’re not tired at all but you kind of try to trick yourself into thinking you’re asleep lmfao. I can’t tell you how many times I’ve done that. I’ll tell you this though it’s bullshit. Also, this is weird as fuck. Sometimes right when I wake up from having a dream, I can actually guess the exact time it is before looking at the time.

The only times I jerk myself awake is when I’m sleeping in school, I fall asleep near a turned-on television, or I fall asleep with my head up right. And sometimes when I’m hearing somebody talking near me. (The teachers talking is probably why I jerk awake in school.) whenever I fall asleep with my head up right, I always have that “falling” dream where you feel like you’re falling from a very high distance (the feeling on a roller coaster) and I jerk awake. Also, for some odd reason, 99% of the time I have dreams is when I sleep during the day. I almost never have dreams at night. I also have a lot of random weird ass dreams that’d make you go wtf.

My favorite kind of dreams are the ones where someone is chasing you trying to kill you because I find those so exciting and it gets your adrenaline going. I actually go to bed hoping for those kinds of dreams. The guy who always chases me though is Jason Voorhees from the Friday the 13th movies. I don’t know why. I love those movies though.

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

@bad dreams

I always work my way through them. I endure it I suppose for the experience. Plus, it never hurts when I get shot. Other times I’ve been bitten by dogs and i just fling them off and find something else to do in my dream. Whenever situations like that happen it seems to be an opportunity to open up lucid practice, allowing me to control my dreams.

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Mr Mopar, post:16, topic:328559”]Sometimes i wake up and i can’t move for like 10 seconds…:|[/quote]Its called sleep paralysis. It happens when you sleep all the time so you don’t perform the actions in real life that you are doing in your dream. If you lay with your arms at your side, breathing like you would while asleep, and basically laying still (as you would while sleeping), you can trick your body into falling asleep while your mind I still awake. It can be hard to do at first ( I can barely get half way without interrupting myself on accident), but you can eventually do it whenever you want. I might try this again now lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:10, topic:328559”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=424946.msg3121596#msg3121596 date=1265571002]
Does everybody always wake up the second something bad is about to happen to them in a dream? I had a random dream yesterday and I woke up just before being shot in the head… ;
[/quote]
I always sleep through dreams where bad things happen to me. They all end with some sort of violent death involving me or someone I know.[/quote]

Mm I don’t like the dreams where there are others involved, and get killed, etc.

[quote=“rip4d, post:12, topic:328559”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=424946.msg3121596#msg3121596 date=1265571002]
Does everybody always wake up the second something bad is about to happen to them in a dream? I had a random dream yesterday and I woke up just before being shot in the head… ;
[/quote]I almost got eaten by a shark in my dream last night, but I woke up in time. It was funny though, because I freely thought that it was going to eat me, and then it turned around and chased after me. I then thought that I was gonna die, and just before it killed me I woke up. God, I have starnge things happen to me in my dreams o.o…[/quote]

Ah I think I had a dream similar to that once, except I escaped it I think… Once I had one where spiders were randomly coming at me, and trying to bite me. Strange enough that I did wake up after one bit me, with a sharp pain at my back. Doubt it was anything to do with the dream though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:5, topic:328559”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=424946.msg3121181#msg3121181 date=1265538876]
Has anyone ever had a dream where like you’re falling and just as you’re about to hit the ground you wake up and your body sort of jumps/spasms?

I have those quite frequently.

[/quote]

For me it’s not that I’m about to hit the ground, I jump as soon as I feel like I’m falling. And this is normal:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypnic_jerk[/quote]
‘irregular sleep schedules’ Explains it for me.

[/quote]considering banages have no forms of anestetics i don’t know why the fuck you’d put a bandaid on. Plus your skin wasn’t broken obviously so WTF…[/quote]I meant I went to get one but realized I wasn’t bleeding before I put it on, I actually took off it’s backing before realizing I was fine (it was on my leg so I didn’t notice I was fine until I pulled up my pant leg).

item.title: Dream Discussion
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“T3arful, post:4, topic:328559”]Has anyone ever had a dream where like you’re falling and just as you’re about to hit the ground you wake up and your body sort of jumps/spasms?

I have those quite frequently.[/quote]

For me it’s not that I’m about to hit the ground, I jump as soon as I feel like I’m falling. And this is normal:

en.wikipedia.org

Hypnic jerk

A hypnic jerk, hypnagogic jerk, sleep start, sleep twitch, myoclonic jerk, or night start is an involuntary twitch which occurs when a person is beginning to fall asleep, often causing them to jump and awaken suddenly for a moment. Hypnic jerks are one form of involuntary muscle twitches called myoclonus. Physically, hypnic jerks resemble the "jump" experienced by a person when startled, sometimes accompanied by a falling sensation. Hypnic jerks are associated with a rapid heartbeat, quicke Accor...

Read full topic
